editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msItem.note: f. i blank; on f. iv is a table of contents, s. xiv ex.

msItem.author: AVERROES
msItem.title: Commentary on ARISTOTLE, De Anima
msItem.incipit: Quoniam de rebus honorabilibus ...; Intendit per subtilitatem confirmationem demonstrationis
msItem.explicit: uisus et auditus et hoc est manifestum.
msItem.note: Ed. F. S. Crawford, Averrois Cordubensis Commentarium Magnum in Aristotelis De Anima Libros (Medieval Academy of America Publs 59: Cambridge, Mass., 1953).

msItem.author: AVERROES
msItem.title: De Substantia Orbis
msItem.incipit: Intendimus in hoc tractatu perscrutari de rebus ex quibus componitur corpus celeste
msItem.note: Pr. in Opera Aristotelis, Venice 1550–2), IX, fols. 3–6.

msItem.author: AVERROES
msItem.title: Commentary on ARISTOTLE, De Sensu et Sensato
msItem.incipit: Virtutes quidem sensibiles quedam sunt de necessitate
msItem.explicit: et de eo in secundo tractatu.

msItem.author: AVERROES
msItem.title: Commentary on ARISTOTLE, De Memoria et Reminiscentia
msItem.incipit: Secundus tractatus incipit perscrutari de rememoratione

msItem.author: AVERROES
msItem.title: Commentary on ARISTOTLE, De Somno et Vigilia
msItem.incipit: Et cum ita diximus de hac uirtute dicendum est de sompno et uigilia
msItem.explicit: et de causis accidentium suorum dictum est.

msItem.author: AVERROES
msItem.title: Commentary on ARISTOTLE, De Morte et Vita
msItem.incipit: Et in hoc tractatu perscrutatur de causis longitudinis et breuitatis uite
msItem.note: Arts 3–6 ed. A. L. Shields and H. Blumberg, Averrois Cordubensis Compendium Librorum Aristotelis qui Parva Naturalia Vocantur (Medieval Academy of America Publ. 54, Cambridge, Mass., 1949), pp. 3–149.

msItem.author: AVERROES
msItem.title: Commentary on ARISTOTLE, Meteora IV
msItem.incipit: Postquam uisum est quod principia et elementaria elementorum
msItem.explicit: in eo quod est ei proprium.
msItem.note: The whole work pr. in Aristotelis ... Opera, Venice 1573–6, V, fols. 400–87v.

msItem.author: AVERROES
msItem.title: Commentary on ARISTOTLE, De Generatione de Corruptione
msItem.incipit: Intencio nostra in hoc libro est quod oportet determinare causas
msItem.note: Ed. F. H. Fobes and S. Kurland, Averrois Cordubensis Commentarium Medium in Aristotelis De Generatione et Corruptione (Medieval Academy of America Publ. 65: Cambridge, Mass., 1956), pp. 3–162.

msItem.author: AVICENNA
msItem.title: Commentary on ARISTOTLE, Metaphysics
msItem.incipit: Postquam autem auxilio Dei expleuimus tractatum de intencionibus scientiarum
msItem.note: Pr. in Auicennae Opera, Venice 1508, fols. 70r-109v; Diaz 1026.

msItem.author: AVICENNA
msItem.title: Physics
msItem.rubric: Liber iste diuiditur in 4. partes. Prima est de causis et principiis naturalium
msItem.incipit: Postquam expediuimus nos auxilio Dei ab eo quod opus fuit preponere ... Iam nosti ex tractatu in quo est scientia probationis
msItem.explicit: (ends mutil. in III c.‘de comitantia et contactu et permixtione’) si autem totum fuerit occupatum, tunc non poterit illud aliud
msItem.note: Pr. Avicennae ... Opera, Venice 1508, fols. 13–36v; eTK 1072G; Diaz 1025.

msItem.author: AVICENNA
msItem.title: De anima
msItem.incipit: Reuerentissimo Tolotane sedis archiepiscopo ... Iohanni Auendenechi Israelita philosophus ...; Iam expleuimus in primo libro uerbum de hiis que sunt communia naturalibus
Liber iste diuiditur in quinque tractatus et unusquisque tractatus diuiditur in sua capitula
Dicemus ergo quod quia primum debemus considerare de hiis
msItem.note: Ed. S. van Riet (2 vols, Louvain/Leiden, 1968, 1972); eTK 0325B, 0648H, 1358A; Diaz 1034.

msItem.author: Ps.-AVICENNA
msItem.title: Commentary on ARISTOTLE, De Caelo et Mundo
msItem.incipit: Collectiones expositionum ab antiquis grecis in libro Aristotelis de mundo
Differentia inter corpus et qualibet animarum magnitudinem
msItem.finalRubric: Completum est capitulum in cuius completione completus est liber. Laus sit creatori ... omni anime modeste et benigne. Explicit liber celi et mundi.
msItem.note: Pr. Avicennae ... Opera, Venice 1508, fols. 37–42v; eTK 0233J, 0429D; Diaz 1020.

msItem.author: AVICENNA
msItem.title: Logica
msItem.incipit: Dico quod intencio philosophie est comprehendere ueritatem omnium rerum
msItem.note: Pr. Avicennae ... Opera, Venice 1508, fols. 2–12; Diaz 931.
Considerable marginalia occurs throughout, but especially near the beginning; the scribe corrects the text, and other early hands annotate, with pointing hands and profile faces.

supportDesc.extent:
179 leaves (i + 178) 350 250
250 165
Retrimmed with loss of marginalia, the edges spattered with red.
supportDesc.collation: A bifolium, the first leaf only a stub, 18, 2–1512, a bifolium; catchwords, and ‘corrigitur’ pencilled at the end of quires.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil or crayon in 2 cols of 51–4 lines.

handDesc.handNote: A single English gothic rotunda bookhand of university type.

decoDesc.decoNote: Blue initials flourished in red; red or blue initials and paraphs. On f. 175v is the miniator’s computation, in red: ‘de magnis litteris viij c; item de paruis litteris v c.’

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii; sewn on five bands; chained from the usual position. The stubs conjugate with f. i and f. 178 were formerly pastedowns in an earlier binding. On f. i are marks from two foredge straps and one each at head and tail; also possible marks of the large iron chain-staple.

history.provenance: Probably made and used at Oxford.

Given to the College by William Reed in 1374: UO49. 21. On f. iv (1) autograph, ‘Liber M. Willelmi Red ex dono magistri Nicholai de Sandwyco. Oretis igitur pro utroque.’ (2) ‘proprietas domus Mertone’. (3) In the usual hand, ‘Liber domus scolarium de Merton’ in Oxon’ in communi libraria eiusdem et ad usum communem sociorum ibidem studencium cathenandus. Ex dono uenerabilis patris domini Willelmi tercii episcopi Cicestrie. Oretis igitur pro eodem et benefactoribus eiusdem ac fidelium animabus a purgatorio liberandis.’ For William Reed, fellow from 1344 until at least 1357, d. 1385, see MS 8. (4) ‘2usde sorte Mothyrby’. William Motherby (BRUO 1324) was fellow in 1390, no longer in 1401. (2), (4) and the table of contents are in a single hand.

Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with a short note of contents, s. xvii, ‘Q. 1. 14. Art:’, s. xvii, canc. and replaced with ‘O. 2. 3’ in red ink, and ‘(CCLXXXII)’ in pencil; the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, p. 112; Powicke, no. 542;AL Codices, no. 371; M.-Th. d’Alverny, ‘Avicenna latinus V’,AHDLMA32 (1965), 257–302, at pp. 286–8.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 41 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Written in a large, rather rough English gothic littera textualis.

decoDesc.decoNote: Unfilled spaces for rubrics and initials.
